etymologies: late 16th century: apparently from white (assimilated to wheat) + arse (assimilated to ear)

definitions: a mainly Eurasian and African songbird related to the chats, with black and buff or black and white plumage and a white rump.

notes.text: Genus Oenanthe, family Turdidae: several species, in particular the gray-backed O. oenanthe of Eurasia and NE Canada

shortDefinitions: songbird with black and buff or black and white plumage
